status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #5422: ARROW-6600: [Java] Implement dictionary-encoded subfields for Union type
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5422
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-6600](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6600).
   
   Implement dictionary-encoded subfields for Union type. Each child vector could be encodable or not.
   
   Meanwhile extra common logic into DictionaryEncoder as well as refactor List subfield encoding to keep consistent with Struct/Union type.
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

+package org.apache.arrow.vector.dictionary;
+
+import org.apache.arrow.memory.BufferAllocator;
+import org.apache.arrow.util.Preconditions;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.FieldVector;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.complex.UnionVector;
+
+/**
+ * Sub fields encoder/decoder for Dictionary encoded {@link UnionVector}.
+ * Notes that child vectors within struct vector can either be dictionary encodeable or not.
+ */
+public class UnionSubfieldEncoder extends StructSubfieldEncoder {
 
 Review comment:
   this class hierarchy does not make sense.  UnionEncoders don't have an "is a" relationship with StructSubfieldEncoder.

emkornfield commented on pull request #5422: ARROW-6600: [Java] Implement dictionary-encoded subfields for Union type
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5422#discussion_r327423444
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/dictionary/UnionSubfieldEncoder.java
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,45 @@
+/*
+ * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
+ * contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with
+ * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.
+ * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0
+ * (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with
+ * the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *    http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package org.apache.arrow.vector.dictionary;
+
+import org.apache.arrow.memory.BufferAllocator;
+import org.apache.arrow.util.Preconditions;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.FieldVector;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.complex.UnionVector;
+
+/**
+ * Sub fields encoder/decoder for Dictionary encoded {@link UnionVector}.
+ * Notes that child vectors within struct vector can either be dictionary encodeable or not.
+ */
+public class UnionSubfieldEncoder extends StructSubfieldEncoder {
 
 Review comment:
   I think the to make this (and repeated fields) generic to program against FieldVector, get all the child vectors, try to encode them and then reconstruct the vector.   Wouldn't there also be an issue creating a dictionary encoded union vectors because the FieldVectors take on the integer type corresponding to the encoding?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5422#discussion_r327432542
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/dictionary/UnionSubfieldEncoder.java
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,45 @@
+/*
+ * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
+ * contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with
+ * this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.
+ * The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0
+ * (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with
+ * the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *    http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package org.apache.arrow.vector.dictionary;
+
+import org.apache.arrow.memory.BufferAllocator;
+import org.apache.arrow.util.Preconditions;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.FieldVector;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.complex.UnionVector;
+
+/**
+ * Sub fields encoder/decoder for Dictionary encoded {@link UnionVector}.
+ * Notes that child vectors within struct vector can either be dictionary encodeable or not.
+ */
+public class UnionSubfieldEncoder extends StructSubfieldEncoder {
 
 Review comment:
   Sure, the encoded UnionVector would have several integer type child vectors(in it's inner structVector), this seems not proper for UnionVector but seems no other choice unless we change the original vector type(i.e. UnionVector->StructVector). We expect this encoded vector only used for decoding(could get each integer vector via getChildrenFromFields API) and not for other purposes.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fields.description:
Implement dictionary-encoded subfields for {{Union}} type. Each child vector could be encodable or not.

 

Meanwhile extra common logic into {{DictionaryEncoder}} as well as refactor List subfield encoding to keep consistent with {{Struct/Union}} type.
fields.summary: [Java] Implement dictionary-encoded subfields for Union type
